questions.question: What will happen to the LED if the GPIO pin connected to it is set to LOW?

answers.a: It will turn off because no voltage is applied

questions.question: Why is the resistor value in this experiment chosen between 330 Ω and 1 kΩ?

answers.a: To balance LED brightness and ensure safe current levels
answers.b: To make the LED glow dimly
answers.c: To prevent the Raspberry Pi from shutting down

questions.question: If the resistor is removed from the circuit, what could happen?

answers.a: Excessive current could damage the LED or GPIO pin
answers.b: The LED will blink more brightly and safely

questions.question: In this experiment, the GPIO pin is connected to the LED's anode. Which pin completes the circuit?
What is the main purpose of toggling the GPIO pin between HIGH and LOW in this experiment?

answers.a: To create a blinking effect by turning the LED on and off

questions.question: Why is it important to use GND as the reference point in the LED circuit?

answers.a: To complete the electrical circuit for current flow
answers.c: To supply voltage to the LED
